Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: JAdlof
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Barrington! The staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are nice and clean and the breakfast is good. Prices are competitive with other hotels in the area. The location has easy access to anywhere via back roads!

Reviews.Title: “not bad for low price”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: stayed there two days, wasnt bad. not great...but not bad for price. little outta the way for places you want to go, wifi kept quitting, shower water kept going from hot to cold, kinda smelled like mildew alittle in the room. but staff was ok. might stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Help above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Jakesnake100
Reviews.Content: We booked this room at the last minute thru hotwire for just a quick day trip to branson with the kids....my wife and I were a little disappointed about the spa not working in the evening, but the kids had a great time in the pool. beds were so so as far as comfort, breakfast was decent. But the real kicker was when we tried to leave and noticed that our car needed a jump. Just when I had resigned myself to paying $50 for a jump, the nice people from behind the desk called a family member to drive from home just to help us out with the jump! So nice to see real customer service somewhere!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No major problems :)”
Reviews.Author: blue_eye81
Reviews.Content: When making reservation by phone, the front desk lady was very nice and pleasant and matched the priceline price that i had found online. Well....at night time its easier to look for the hotel cause the letters on the building are big but at day time its very hard to find the small Barrington Hotel sign on side of road. Did not match up on gps. Pool was really cold but spa was awesome! Bedspread was little worn but maybe that's because we were in a room that allowed pets because we brought our chihuahua. Breakfast was great! Pillows were very comfortable! Front desk was very helpful with questions i had about where everything I was looking for around the area (good ice cream, where to eat, etc.) And when my son fell down outside and scratched his knee (his own doing) the front desk lady went in to her own purse and got band-aids for my son since the hotel had only small band-aids. :) There was a worn floss pick on the floor when we first arrived in our room tho :(.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: teddies1999
Reviews.Content: Great location nearby to shows beds very comfortable breakfast was ok got down at 830 and they were out of donuts and other items housekeeping was excellent. Only bad thing was door was locked at 10pm and you had to park and walk all the way around to front of building to get in

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable experience”
Reviews.Author: Sherrie J
Reviews.Content: Unlike some other reviewers we found the pool and hot tub to be clean, well stocked with towels, and the water warm enough. We did have to complain to the front desk about people letting their kids run wild in the pool room and they tried to quieten them. The next morning when I went down to ask about breakfast the hotel manager was berating a female staff member in aloud and condescending manner. I thought that was unprofessional and walked out without asking my question. I go on vacation to get away from my boss, not see another person's boss go off on them. The breakfast was good, even though I was a bit shaken up by what I'd seen and heard, but they need to take about half the tables out of the breakfast room to make it more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Quiet rooms, with breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: Bill O
Reviews.Content: Really clean, quiet and affordable. The breakfast was great especially their biscuits and gravy. Flat screen TV and port on radio for ipod/mp3 player. The pillow top beds are great, very comfortable. Air conditioner works great. I like that wi-fi and breakfast were included in price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and service”
Reviews.Author: MimiRochester_Mass
Reviews.Content: Our reservations were made through the Branson Tourism center. I felt like we purchased a very reasonable package which included a two night stay and tickets to 3 attractions. My husband and I were traveling with my mom and had requested 2 adjoining rooms. When we arrived to check in, we were told that there were no adjoining rooms available. Upon further investigation, we discovered that the error was with the hotel and not the tourism agency. The hotel was very apologetic and offered us a complimentary night stay, which we accepted. All the staff are extremely courteous and helpful. We did not use the indoor pool but it looked very nice. The complimentary breakfast was very convenient and offers a good selection of breakfast items. The hotel location is convenient. The rooms were clean. The bathrooms are clean but the sink area could be more spacious. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed...much better than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: 2kidsandahubby
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very clean. Really nice staff. Breakfast was blah ... Would definitely recommend this hotel, though. We really liked it. Kids loved the pool. Will probably try to stay here again on our next trip to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...”
Reviews.Author: Greg S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with kids for 2 nights while on vacation. The hotel is located on Sheperd of the Hills Exp closer to the new Branson Landing. The hotel was very nice inside & out and had a very nice hotel staff. We were greeted by everyone that worked there when coming in contact with them. There was an indoor pool/hot tub & nice free breakfast each morning. The had a double-bed room that was very spacious with large bathroom & mini refridgerator. The air conditioning worked perfect, almost too perfect. This is a quiet area & I don't recall being awaken by outside noise. The hotel also gave us a 15% off coupon for our next stay. We go to Branson every year and have stayed in several places, the Barrington is now one of my favorites & we would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Cara B
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Barrington Inn and Suites in Branson, Missouri. The hotel was very clean (even for this germophobe) and comfortable. The hot breakfast was great and had many choices. We were close to everything we wanted to do and see in Branson, but weren't bothered by traffic noises. The staff was friendly and helpful. I definitely will stay here again when I return to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Not one single problem!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barrington for 6 nights, front desk was very helpful, immediately booked tickets to a show for us with great seats. We went to the included breakfast each morning, typical breakfast foods, my kids gave it an A+! Pool was very clean and hot tub was hot. Our room was neat and tidy and comes with an included refrigerator with no extra charge. Microwave is accessible at anytime downstairs. Has icecream vending machines another plus for my kiddos. Lots of tourist info. If you are planning a trip to Branson, you won't be disappointed with your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “was a good stay”
Reviews.Author: sucrowd
Reviews.Content: This our second time in Branson and our stay in this hotel is nice. They have an indoor pool which my kids love, it was clean. Breakfast was good and clean as well. They have a good wifi and they have computer to use. We did not have any problem with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: fischerpat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barrington for 5 nights. This hotel is not only beautiful, it is extremely clean and comfortable. The breakfast served includes hot and protein items, sausage, eggs, etc, as well as all the typical carbohydrate choices. I found the bed a bit hard and the hot tub tepid, but this were just details that in no way affected our stay. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “best hospitality and accommodations in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: welovevacations1984
Reviews.Content: Need to find an awesome place to stay in Branson where you are away from the hustle and bustle but near everything you need to go to? My friend and I took our kids June 30 - July 3 and stayed at this fabulous hotel. The hotel rooms were clean, roomy and comfortable. The amenities were more that what we expected. The continental breakfast - never better! The very best part of this hotel? The personnel! They had several large conventions there and about 100 people in the lobby, but treated our small party as important as the large convention that arrived there. Any time we needed to ask them to help us find an attraction, etc, they were more than helpful with us. Where will I stay next time I go to Branson? That is a no brainer - the Barrington Hotel and Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: conniej238
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barrington 2 nights in May for a group couples' trip. The hotel was adequate for our stay. The room was clean, beds okay, and staff friendly. We had good internet connection. They were very accomodating for the large crowd at the complimentary breakfast. They kept it open longer and continued putting food out as long people were coming. My husband needed to use the hotel printer and thought the clerk was kidding when he was told it was 10 cents per sheet. He paid for 10 sheets, used 6 and bought the remaining 4 back to get his 40 cents back. We would not stay here if we came alone as a couple or with our family, but we would again for a group trip to be with everyone else. They gave us good rates and we were gone all day...just needed a good, safe, clean place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL AWAY FROM THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: thomas m
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be clean and comfortable at a good rate. We like the fact that it was off the strip, but still close to everything. The staff was courteous and helpful with directions, advice, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Branson!!!”
Reviews.Author: bonnerpsrings4
Reviews.Content: Was in Branson for 4 days and 3 nights. The hotel is in a great location since it is off the strip and it is easy to get everything in Branson. The staff is really nice and was helpful in answering any questions you had about Branson. The rooms and the breakfast was great for my three year old and for my six year old!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: osucowboys
Reviews.Content: For the price, this was a great hotel. Breakfast, free Wifi, and close to red route. Rooms a little small but we didn't spend a whole lot of time in the rooms anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the night”
Reviews.Author: rscjtravelers
Reviews.Content: We purchased this hotel through Hotwire and we were not sure what to expect. However, the hotel was a very nice surprise. The room was very clean, the lobby was very nice and the staff was extremely friendly. As I said, we were only there for one night, but we were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Ali-Karacalar
Reviews.Content: I arranged this hotel thru one of those 'pay-first-and-learn-which-hotel-later' sites. At first, not being with the familiar with the name Barrington, I was kind of sceptical. But my worries turned out to be groundless when I saw the hotel. It is a very clean, very well-kept hotel. I am hereby thanking all the maids who are working to their bones to maintain this standard. For me, with a help from my navigator, the location of the hotel was just perfect. Nearby a major highway but not getting much noise. The Sights and Sounds theater is less than a mile (Joseph is a must-see). Tangers Mall iss about 3 miles away. And downtown Branson is also about 3 miles away. The room was nice size. The beds were comfortable. But I cannot say the same things for the bathroom. It was small and crampy - well, kind of. There was hardly enough counter space for one person to put the cosmetics. If you are staying two people (we were), one of you will have to put the stuff somewhere else. Also there is no hanger behind the bathroom door. You just do not know where to even put your clothes (note that I said put, not hang). Every person has a different taste and different expectations but to me, breakfast was a bit more than average. The always smiling ladies take so wonderful care of the breakfast hall. All in all, this hotel was such a pleasant surprise for me and I will stay again here if I go to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to locate.”
Reviews.Author: MEKA_12
Reviews.Content: Modern, new hotel but hard to find from the interstate. Called the front desk for directions, girl said she was new and wasn't sure of the names of the cross streets! Room was clean, however the bathroom was extremely small, no counter space for cosmetics, etc. Beds were comfortable. Breakfast room was noisy , very crowded, only powdered creamer for coffee, no yogurt, only fresh fruit was small wedges of oranges. Could be improved. Stayed 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: mashymom
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the outside, off the beaten path, "institutional" look of the Barrington Hotel. The inside was up-to-date comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were comfortable. The parking was ample, even for our big truck and the location to the outside look of the city was perfect! Breakfast resembled a cattle-call but the ladies managing the room are saints....oh my, they kept their cool when I would likely have bopped a few kids on the head and punched a few rude adults; good grief, they should pass out buffet ettiquette when you check in....yep, you just gotta laugh!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Carole H
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Barrington. It is an older hotel with hardwood floors in the lobby, etc. and has a feel of the past. However, it is kept up-to-date with clean modern rooms and baths. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cheap, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol_rn73
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at The Barrington. The room was very clean. The complimentary breakfast was good(many choices) Adequate parking available. Wi-fi worked well. Location was away from most attractions, but only a short drive to anything. All for $66.00 per night. We would stay there again if in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: silverspiffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend. It was $74 through them. Priceline was only $58. We were already there when I found out their price....they couldn't Lower their price, so I booked it through Priceline on my phone in their parking lot ;-) When we left on Sunday, the maids were cleaning the WHOLE hotel. I was impressed at their thoroughness. The hotel looks like it has been redone inside. Their aren't any closets, but their are places to hang clothes. They did a good job remodeling the place. It is up to date. The breakfast was mediocre at best. They were very busy, so were out of fresh fruit. Their weren't many options for other foods. The biscuits were hard and rubbery. We left hungry. Overall, a great stay. Very clean hotel with nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel - scary experience with help”
Reviews.Author: ggsgrandma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barrington as part of a package we found online. The hotel is nice and the hot tub actually worked, which was good. I depend on using the Wi-Fi in hotels and theirs never worked while we were there. I went down each day to see if they had gotten it re-set and they kept telling me it was my device. So we took my device to Best Buy and the guy said it was their problem, not mine. He saw the error message. So again I asked and they just said it was not their problem. That didn't set well with me, knowing they just didn't want to fix it. Then the last morning we were there, my husband had left the room for awhile and I was laying in bed when a man walked into my room....no knock, nothing. I yelled and he turned and left. Found out later it was one of their staff. I had the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door and he didn't even pay attention. We did complain as we were leaving. If we hadn't been scheduled to leave that day, we would have anyway. I can't and won't stay anywhere where I don't feel safe. I read 2 other reviews where people had this happen (before we went down) and we talked about it and how scary that would be. When it happened, I was just furious. I'm hoping that person is no longer employed because he obviously can't follow directions. I found the people at the front desk not very willing to help and not very friendly. We stayed as part of a package, so had no choice, but wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms but good service”
Reviews.Author: Michelle T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice for a cheap place to stay, It is clean and you get breakfast in the morning. There was hot water for showers, good attentive managers, and the breakfast ladies in the morning were very kind. It was a find place and we stayed for $43/night.

Reviews.Title: “Musical rooms”
Reviews.Author: welovedancing
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and were given our room keys. After we lugged our heavy bags to the room we saw that the door was open so we asked what was going on. The very nice gentleman-who had been attempting to unstop the toilet called someone for us. When she arrived she informed us that we were supposed to have been assigned a different room, and took us there. We had just deposited our luggage on the bench and floor when she came back and informed us that we were not supposed to have that room either. So we picked up our luggage and went out into the hall to wait to see where we were to be. She finally returned and took us up to the fourth floor to another room. I mentioned that I thought we should be comped for all of our trouble but she ignored me.We got to the room and again deposited our luggage and I went to look out the window only to discover that an addition had been built that went halfway up our window! I immediately went down to the desk and told the manager the room was unacceptable. He assigned us another room, to which we once again lugged our bags. I try to be patient but this was ridiculous! In addition to that, I didn't like the fact that the rooms didn't have closets-just a bench and a rack above it. The breakfast was not very good either-but I do realize its hard to serve anything truly good at the average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Ginger B
Reviews.Content: We found the staff so friendly and helpful. Our room was the king suite with a jacuzzi tub in the room....FANTASTIC !! ..it was clean and the bed was really comfy. The only complaint I have about the room was the fact that the door didnt close on its own and we had to constantly make sure it was latched. The breakfast was ok, I would of loved more hot food but it wasnt bad for being free. Its off the main drag(the reason we chose to stay there) but it was easy to get to and from the activities in town. Overall we enjoyed our stay, and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always dependable”
Reviews.Author: mamagirl3
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here about 6 times. The rooms are always nice. Comfortable. We enjoy the difference in their room layout that the sink is in the bathroom...NOT THE ROOM and has a lovely mahogany built-in under the sink for all your vanity needs.both cabinets and drawers! I also love places like this that include the lovely makeup remover packs! Full Hot breakfast... Not just pastry & coffee. There is a chef attendant in the breakfast room to assist with waffles/sausage gravy/etc

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Holly G
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay and enjoyed this hotel. They had a very friendly staff and it came recommended! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jbutler1
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for two nights. Complaints include vending machines taking money. The key reader on our door stopped working and they would not fix it or offer another room. We were just ask to stay in our room and not leave. We enjoyed the breakfast, it included biscuits and gravy, sausage Patty, waffles, cereal and some fruit. The indoor pool and spa are quite nice. Overall I would stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: nancuj85
Reviews.Content: Front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. Clean rooms and an ok breakfast. The location is great because it is off the main drag and away from the heavy traffic but convenient to almost everything in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Below my expectations”
Reviews.Author: HarleyWichitaKS_
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews. I can not agree with the friendly staff part at all. The front desk was friendly enough, along with a guy that shared the elevator with me. The gal running the vac was very rude with starting the vac up right in the middle of us checking in that evening. The next morning I was not able to get into the breakfast room. I thought maybe I was in the wrong location so I went and found a cleaning lady right down the hall from it. I asked her where the breakfast was being served. Her answer was " OH, I'M SORRY I DON'T KNOW"....come on now! I went back to the location I thought was the place and waited for someone to open the door from the other side. Sure enough this was the breakfast room, but the door would not open for me, I tried my door key over and over, no luck. I did get to breakfast right at 9:30, which is the cut off time. There wasn't much to choose from. Donuts or toast and a hard boiled egg was it. Then I walked by a lady vacuuming, two different times. She didn't smile, nod her head, speak, nothing! It was like she didn't want to be there and didn't want me to be there either. The carpet in the halls looked new and our room was ok, nothing above the average room. Door allowed light into the room, used a towel to block it.This hotel is off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: irish194960
Reviews.Content: this was an excellent place to stay, staff were friendly, breakfast was good, very quiet and everyone made you feel like it was home.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: trbtazz
Reviews.Content: Me and my Husband had the Honeymoon suite and it was Awesome! We will so be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Timing is Everything”
Reviews.Author: bobemac
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at this property. Unfortunately we stayed at the Barrington during the season of the Bus People, Bus season in Branson runs during September, October, and November. This was our first visit. When we showed up for our free breakfast we found chaos in the breakfast lounge. There were over 150 folks milling around. They came from three different buses staying at the Barrington. This property would get a higher rating because it has been updated and it is quite nice. The front desk clerks were very friendly. Sherrie helped us with some restaurant suggestions. The breakfast consisted of dry cereal, hard-boiled eggs, sausage patties, SOS, oranges, pears, toast, bagels, and grits. We skipped breakfast next time due to the hassle. The property is located in a quiet area away from the 76 Strip. We used the fitness room and the pool and hot tub. They were all great. No king size beds at this property and no microwaves in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A Branson Value”
Reviews.Author: Bill H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights in the Barrington’s Presidential suite and enjoyed our time there very much. The single room suite was large and airy with the usual amenities, e.g., microwave, fridge, granite countertop with sink, coffee maker, etc. And what Presidential suite would be complete without the large corner jacuzzi with wrap around mirrors and towels shaped as swans? The king size bed was tastefully appointed and very comfortable. The air conditioner was quiet and did its job well. The only disappointment was the bathroom. It’s as if the decorator left the building without finishing the job. It was clean and roomy but totally without the eye appeal that you might expect in a Presidential suite. The bathroom ceiling was low and not well done. However, the biggest bath room negative was that it was without an exhaust fan. The Continental breakfast area is located on the third floor which is really more convenient than the usual first floor lobby area. The breakfast choices were ample and well presented. It was attended at all times by courteous staff. The hotel is located between two busy traffic corridors but far enough away to provide a quiet environment. The facility accommodates a lot of bus tour patrons which are well cared for and managed by the friendly hotel staff. Despite the few negatives, there is definite value at the Barrington and we will stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: valerie b
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights on Sept.29th and the hotel was nicer than we expected as we are used to staying at a Hilton or Wyndham, but it was pretty clean. Bed's were very comfortable. The breakfast was not all that good, we ended up buying our own breakfast. Our only real set back was on our last night there the hotel issued someone our room keys and they came into our room as we were sitting in bed watching TV.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kristaldo
Reviews.Content: Very clean and welcoming hotel. Indoor pool was nice with a hot tub. Breakfast was ok, but I could not ask more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend with the Chicas”
Reviews.Author: SHOW-ME-VACA
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I needed a Girls Weekend. As what girls do...our weekend was spent on SHOPPING! Where to shop? You must check out the Tanger Outlet Stores and The Landing. I've stayed at the Barrington before, but this would be my 1st review. All I can say is this stay was better than the last. The reason was before, they were renovating the hotel. The hotel then seemed dingy and old. Now, it's newly renovated and fresh. It even smelled good when we first walked in. The front desk was friendly and hospitable. They greeted us with smiles and seemed to really be accepting to have us as their guests for the weekend. There is ample amount of parking at the front and back of the hotel. The rooms were spacious and clean. The hotel also serves free breakfast, but be early or you won't have much food to eat. It seems that 1 hour before they close the hospitality room, they don't refurnish food. This hotel is not on the 76 strip but we were very close to it. It was good not to hassle with the traffic on the strip. Try to avoid the strip and use the other routes if you can help it. If you want to be adventurous... go ziplining! Use the Branson Zip Tours, which is located "outside" of Branson and not "in" Branson. The tour "in" Branson seems boring. Who wants to zipline and see tops of buildings? As for the Branson Zip Tours, you zip above tree tops. We chose the "express" zip which is their longest line. However, be ready because at the end of the line, the only way down is to jump 100-feet free fall. We were scared at first, but it wasn't really that bad. Yes, you seem to be jumping off a plank on a ship, but it was exhilarating! Also, don't miss the Dixie Stampede! It's by far my most favorite show on the strip. As for food... Joe's Crab Shack!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: JAdlof
Reviews.Content: We were at the Barrington over Labor Day Weekend. It was nice, modern and most importantly clean. Breakfast was good and staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay”
Reviews.Author: Knoxfamily
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice place to stay to enjoy Branson Mo. It is clean, quiet and comfortable. The staff was so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TroySunflower
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. We liked the inside corridors,and the staff were the most helpful of any place we've ever stayed. They offered information about about driving shortcuts after shows and such. They were very friendly too. The beds were very comfortable and everything was clean. Their were fresh apples in the lobby for the guests every day. It's a little off the "beaten path", but after the first day of finding our way around, it was easy to drive back to the hotel, and we like the "peace and quiet" while on vacation. It's very close to the "Sights" and Sound" theather. Also, there was a very good breakfast with waffles, boiled eggs, sausage, gravy, cereal, pasteries, fresh oranges, juice, etc. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in Branson”
Reviews.Author: kreplatch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Branson with another couple just for a vacation over the Labor Day weekend. We had never been to Branson, Mo, before, so I looked for reviews and availability. I saw a vast majority of positive reviews for the Barrington Inn and decided to choose them for our rooms. We were duly impressed! The hotel seems hidden, but that may be a good thing; I consider the Barrington Inn the best-kept secret in Branson! The hotel interior was clean, modern and bright. The reception staff was very friendly and helpful. Best of all, the room were clean and the beds were VERY comfy! The halls were quiet at night, even with the large influx of people that were booked there. The continental breakfast was tasty and had a good selection of breakfast items to choose from. Get to the breakfast room early, as it fills up fast. We had a very enjoyable time in Branson- that was helped by the excellent stay at the Barrington Inn. We will definitely pick the Barrington next visit! VET'S NOTE: Ask by phone for the military rate. A real deal!

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased with the Barrington Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rtvanness
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Branson and I was initially concerned about the location, as it is not in the main strip or hotel area. In fact, the area surrounding the hotel was rather quiet, a plus. The location wasn't really a problem as we, and most people I saw, drove everywhere. The drive to the attractions was about 5 mins. We had a standard room, not one of the suites. It included a small refrigerator. The breakfast was average. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I have no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience! We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: After having a horrible experience at another hotel in Branson, we made a last minute reservation at Barrington Hotel. It was a really good price online and had good reviews, so we booked it. It's not right on the strip, which was actually quite nice. Upon arriving, the lobby area was beautiful and the staff was very helpful and served us with a smile. Our room , a double queen, was plenty of room for our family of four. It was very clean and felt new. After we had been there an hour, we got a courtesy call from the front desk asking if we needed anything else for our stay. Awesome service. The breakfast was good, although the dining room was smaller and a little packed. Our daughters also loved the indoor pool. We will definitely stay here again, they have made us fans. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancy2009
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Barrington since it has been remodeled. We have enjoyed visit/stay at the Barrington. The beds are comfortable, the rooms and hotel are modern and clean. The pool area is also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay again”
Reviews.Author: craftlady011
Reviews.Content: The Barrington Hotel was a great place. It was clean and well kept. The employees were friendly and very helpful. The total service was great. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and fmaily. Thanks for a great experience in Branson. Becky Moore, Oklahoma

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: ilovetozipline
Reviews.Content: We took our employees on a retreat and wanted something central to all the activities we had planned. This was it. For the price, I was VERY impressed. Beds were VERY VERY VERY COMFY. Pillows = Fantastic. Check in process was a bit ridiculous but that could very well be because they made us check in every single person (10 of us) & all their cars. Can't comment on anything but the room (great for the money) the breakfast buffet (free / or, was included in what we paid for) and that was better than I thought it would be. Negatives --- seemed very noisey, door to my room would never shut by itself; always had to push it closed. I'd stay here again but don't imagine I'll be going back to Branson anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonable, comfortable, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: OldRoamingGnome
Reviews.Content: We went to Branson for the day and ran across the Barrington. Rates were resonable, the room, while one of their smaller ones, was exceptionally clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was a little more varied than you find at some places. The staff was helpful and friendly. They are not on hwy 76, the main drag, which is a good thing. Less traffic, less noise and only 5 minutes to the main drag. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal !”
Reviews.Author: MissouriSherry
Reviews.Content: I spend a lot of time picking a hotel. I always want to find a good priced hotel but I want it to be nice. The Barrington fit both those criterias. The room was clean and the staff was helpful. My favorite of course was the free breakfast. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: BransonRegular
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 days and 3 nights in Branson. It was a last minute trip and our normal hotel was booked. The Barrington was the only dog friendly hotel available. Wow, were we surprised. Very nice, very clean. One review said they didn't have hair dryers so we took ours. They had everything: shampoo, hair dryer, iron, the works. The rooms have a small refrigerator too as well as large flat screen TVs. Was it the Hilton, no, but it was every bit as nice as any Holiday Inn Express we've stayed in for much less money. We will stay here again! It is a little further away from the strip, but once you get your bearings, everything is easy to find. Very nice choice! Best price in town and much, much nicer than we expected. If you stay at LaQuinta, Holiday Inn, Quality or Comfort Inn, try the Barrington. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Get In Writing The Rates They Quote”
Reviews.Author: 1405Loved
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is beautifully decorated but very small visiting room and lobby. If you have more than 4 in your party it is extremely difficult to all be in the same area. Dining room very small and gets really crowded for seating and trying to fix your food. The dining room staff were exceptionally nice and accomodating, but needed more support from staff. We will never stay there again because of front desk and check in procedures.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay! Top of the line!”
Reviews.Author: specialteacherokc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Barrington on our honeymoon. It was absolutely gorgeous. We travel to Branson frequently, and yet, I was unfamiliar with this hotel. It is definately one of Branson's best kept secrets. Not only is it away from the the hussle and bussle of the "main drag," but the hotel is beautifully decorated and most importantly very clean! We had reserved a junior suite, but when we got to the hotel late on our wedding night, we had been upgraded to the Presidential Suite! The private balcony (although it could have had a better view) and hot tub were wonderful amenities. The bed was super soft, as were the pillows. The bathroom is huge! There is a kitchenette and a large TV that swivels towards the bed or the in-room hot tub. The hot continental breakfast is served by actual chefs. They do have a public spa and pool, although we didn't use them. I would definately recommend the Barrington for any occassion, and the Presidential Suite for a special occassion. My only warning: Put your "DO NOT DISTURB" sign out. At 9:00am, while we were still sleeping, we had a maid knocking on our door wanting our towels. About 30 minutes later, a gentleman was knocking on the door for the same reason. They obviously like to get their towels as soon as possible in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, courteous”
Reviews.Author: racpie
Reviews.Content: This was my family of four's 2nd stay at the Barrington. It's furnishings are up-to-date, beds are comfortable, the staff is very friendly and helpful, the pool and hot tub are clean and well maintained. You can even get coupons on their website. We will stay here again. It's off the main strip but close to everything. My only complaint is the breakfast. I am thankful it was free. It didn't have many choices I liked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EWheelerLousiana
Reviews.Content: Reserved 2 rooms for my family. The check in was easy adn the clerk was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were updated and very clean with quality linens. The free breakfast was outstanding and included a great variety of "cotinental" items to include waffles. The hotel is a little off the beaten path but well worth the value. This hotel exceeded my expectations in area.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy when you walk in”
Reviews.Author: ZAXIBEE
Reviews.Content: Great last minute decision to stay here due to bad weather. Gracious staff at checkin, which was a breeze. Coming out of the cold into a warm lobby with a raging fire was fantastic late at night. Breakfast was standard fare, breads, cereal, muffins, hot waffles, hardboiled eggs, canned fruit, donuts, juice and watery coffee. The rooms have been updated recently, and were very comfortable. The heater was odd, as it didn't allow an on / auto option, making it a little hard to get to sleep because it kept turning itself on and off every few seconds. Fast free wireless was a plus. Ice cream vending machine was great for a treat. I will definitey stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: brightfuture16
Reviews.Content: The remodel IS lovely. I was VERY impressed. Sometimes you can tell if a hotel is on its way out, this is definitely not the case here. Everything was clean and orderly. All the staff were friendly and helpful. I thought the breakfast was over the top for the price, very nice. Both sausage and hard boiled eggs for protein options. Thought the waffle making stations was fun. A lot better than some cereal and cold donuts. We had a great time in the pool. Someone in the elevator mentioned it was cold for her baby, but the teens and child in group were fine. The pool area looks so nice, they even had padded seats in addition to the regular deck chairs. Location: It's a place to stay, not to enjoy views, that was fine with us. The view out the window was not great. Rooms: probably on the small side, but if you are going to be out and about, wouldn't matter. If you have small kids in tow and are more centered in your room, it might be a little tight but not a deal breaker. We didn't sleep well with the heat/ac unit switching on and off all night. I even turned it off and it still switched on and off, not sure what's up with that. I was so happy with everything else, I didn't care. I thought the bathroom was especially nice, they have make-up remover wipes. The counter was granite and the vanity was actually pretty and not utilitarian. Will be telling friends about this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: crackerback2000
Reviews.Content: Great overall stay! Hotel was clean, rooms were nice and it was great value...good location off the strip but easy to get to everything! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Most Gracious!”
Reviews.Author: velcromom
Reviews.Content: The re-model is lovely. Our group was very well-cared for. They were full and the breakfast was hard to get a seat at. The bathrooms have pretty much no counterspace, and are cramped, but all else was as good as it gets. The beds were awesome, linens and pillows above average. Our group kept us moving. so we rarely lounged in the room, but it was exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, and Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: roadweary65
Reviews.Content: Three generation ladies weekend away. Close to dining, shopping, and shows. Easy in and out. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Updated and tasteful. Good breakfast, pleasant and helpful staff. Got a great last minute deal on hotels.com

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: lovephilandi
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Branson, Mo. We stayed at the Barrington Hotel. I can't say enough about this wonderful place. The staff is friendly, attentive. They even called our room shortly after checking in to see if there was anything we needed/that everything was alright. The location is close to most attractions but not so close that you're bombarded with all of the tourist traffic on the main strip. The free breakfast is right on time.. even have do it yourself waffles... and I won't even mention the special perk.. they have ice cream vending machines.. yay! We would definitely stay there again. It was truly an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: mbamvakais
Reviews.Content: this was one of the best places i have stayed in while in branson and i visit every other year its away for the noise and quiet. very clean and staff very helpful don't know why it is so far down the list of places to stay in branson i know i will be back breakfast was great VERYCLEAN

Reviews.Title: “Nice room & clean!”
Reviews.Author: Teacher465
Reviews.Content: I'm picky when it comes to hotels. I searched a long time before choosing this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The lobby, room, bathroom, hallways, and swimming area were all clean. The staff was very friendly. The breakfast was great, too. It is located off of 76 Blvd. (which was fine with me). Free Wi-Fi was a plus for our teenagers. Parking is limited if you arrive back to the hotel late at night. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: justaladyintx
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time and the staff and room was Great. Never expierenced any problems. The hotel was decorated so nice. The breakfast was good but wish the times was longer, we had to rush to meet the cutoff time. And Parking was slim if you came in after dark. But Enjoyed out stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: buckeyegirl010
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice place to stay and I am a hotel "snob" (meaning I want a nice place to stay while traveling).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient for our family weekend in Branson”
Reviews.Author: nucpharm29
Reviews.Content: We booked Barrington Hotel and Suited through the Silver Dollar City website as a part of a package deal. This hotel met all of our needs for our weekend getaway. The staff was very friendly upon check-in and whenever we encountered someone in the hallway. Our room was more than adequate for the 4 of us. The beds were comfortable and the furnishings and carpet look new. I appreciated having a mini-fridge in the room. I would've liked a microwave also to warm up leftovers. The bathroom is smallish, but clean and adequate. The location of the hotel is not on the main drag in Branson. There are a couple theaters close, Kirby Van burch and the Mansion. But most of the action is not within walking distance. This was not a problem for us as we were spending most of our time at Silver Dollar City. The hotel does have quick access to Branson Landing which has lots of shops and restaurants. We enjoyed our stay here and would stay again. Definitely worth the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better with just a bit of work”
Reviews.Author: truebluekat
Reviews.Content: Best feature: looks of jacuzzi room. Price for what you get was fair. Needs to improve: Cleanliness of tubs was lacking. Stray hairs were present. Pool upkeep seriously lacking - front desk made aware of an unsanitary situation that was not resolved. Was not given a receipt upon checkout at the front desk. Online photos of the hotel did not look like the actual hotel. Mattress not that comfortable. Worst feature: the air conditioner noise in the rooms kept me up all night.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Best hotel in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: RLCgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our daughter and grandchildren to Branson to SDC and stayed at the Barrington for the first time. It is beautiful. From the time that I made the reservation over the phone to the time that we checked out, the hotel staff was above and beyond friendly and helpful. The pool was wonderful and clean. The room was very nice and spacious and reasonably priced. Refrigerator in the room thrilled the kids! We will definitely stay here the next time we are in Branson. You never know what to expect when you reserve a room based on pictures, but this one is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best!”
Reviews.Author: bpnkay
Reviews.Content: Our first room here had a big wet spot on the carpet from who knows what. The manager came promptly when called and offered another room which we declined since we couldn't find a problem and it wasnt that big of a deal. However, when we took a shower later, we discovered the bathtub wasnt very clean and the hairdryer didnt work. When we called the front desk about the new problems, they immediately moved us to another room down the hall. This room was ok except for the strange smell which had a close resemblance to cigarette smoke cover up. The shower head was spraying water out behind it, all over the ceiling and over the curtain onto the lavatory and floor. Maintenance fixed it the next day while we were gone. Overall, the staff was very friendly, accomodating and very prompt with the problems. It sounds like we complained alot but the rooms really had those problems that needing attending to. We stayed on the 4th floor which was quiet. The beds and pillows were comfortable and clean. We didnt use the indoor pool but it looked nice. Since we usually go to SDC when we are in Branson and this hotel is not very close to anything, we will more than likely stay at a different hotel next time. There arent many eating places close to the hotel either so we had to drive a good bit to eat. The breakfast was good and the hostesses were very efficient and friendly and kept the place clean and stocked very well. However, if you want to get something to eat without having to fight your way around the place or to get a table, you better eat before 8am during this time of year. The breakfast area could be laid out better to accomodate bigger crowds. All the food and drinks were crammed in a tiny part of the room so that everyone had to step on each other. I've had this kind of breakfast at other hotels with crowds and it was much easier to get something to eat. We decided it was easier to get something to eat at one of the local restaurants even though it was added expense. Overall, the hotel was mediocre compared with others we've stayed at with similar rates even though it has been recently remodeled. We might would stay here again if we had attractions that we were going to on the east side of town but other than that, will most probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, friendly staff, awesome pool area...breakfast, not as good.”
Reviews.Author: KeturahIshtari
Reviews.Content: My mom and I booked a travel package through the Branson Tourism Center, and were placed at the Barrington for a three night stay during the week (Monday through Wednesday). We arrived a little bit early, and although the Tourism Center told us check in was 3pm, the front desk staff had no trouble allowing us to check in a little bit early, around noon. We had requested a ground floor room for easy access because we are both disabled, however, upon arriving at the hotel we discovered that due to the fact that the Barrington is located on a hill, there is direct parking lot access from both the first and second floor, as well as a central elevator with access to all floors. We accepted a room on the second floor, and the front desk clerk was nice enough to put us as close to the second floor's outside access door as she could. It definitely made unloading our luggage and subsequent shopping purchases MUCH easier. The rooms were nicely appointed and clean. The beds were comfortable, there were plenty of clean towels, the room contained a small mini-fridge for our drinks, and a flat-panel television to watch during our downtime. The in-room air conditioning unit appeared to be fairly new, and we appreciated how well it worked considering the sweltering heat and unbearable humidity Branson was experiencing during our stay. The pool area at the Barrington is exceptional, and contains a large hot tub and a pool that was, to me, surprisingly large and 8 foot deep at the deepest end. There is plenty of room whether you are swimming for recreation or exercise. Additionally, I was VERY impressed by the handicapped access to the pool. One entrance to the pool area requires that you climb a short flight of stairs, but there is an additional entrance that is equipped with a wheelchair lift/elevator. I had never seen pool access quite like it. The pool itself has a wide staircase at the shallow end to allow for easy access for the handicapped/disabled. The pool area is kept very clean and stocked with plenty of extra towels, eliminating the need to bring towels from your room. The only disappointment we encountered at the Barrington was the complimentary breakfast bar, which is offered from 6:30-9:30 am in the third floor conference room. The selection was large and included biscuits and gravy, a selection of cereals, bagels, donuts, boiled eggs, sausage, bacon, fruits, juice and coffee, however many of the offerings were nearly inedible. One morning, the biscuits were served individually wrapped in foil, and they were so hard you could have used them as a weapon. The following day, they were much softer, but lacked flavor, and the gravy had the same texture and taste as the flour/water paste that is sometimes used for craft projects. Both the donuts and the bagels were exceptionally dry, the sausage was bland, and the fruit selections were somewhat under-ripe. On a positive note, though, the highlight of the breakfast, were the waffles, which we were allowed to make fresh. There were waffle irons provided, along with a dispenser and small disposable cups that each held enough batter to make one waffle. Plenty of butter and syrup was provided, and we were able to make a pretty decent breakfast on the waffles and bacon provided. So breakfast ended up not being a total wash, but I think the hotel could save itself some money and customer dis-satisfaction by offering LESS selection but higher quality foods. Overall, the Barrington was well maintained and well appointed, the staff were friendly without exception, and the location-away from the noise and traffic of the strip, but centrally located and convenient to both attractions and shopping locations-made it the ideal hotel for our stay. I would DEFINITELY recommend the Barrington to anyone considering a stay in Branson, and will likely book there again for upcoming trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice For the Price”
Reviews.Author: luvnlif
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised for the price at how new this hotel was. Fresh apples were awaiting guests at the front counter, Indoor pool was nice but if you weren't swimming you could not sit in there, it was a sauna, so that was disappointing. We had a few little black bugs crawling around, but other than that it was very clean. Our friends stated their sheets had hairs all over it and had to have housekeeping come change them, however, the front desk told them housekeeping was gone for the day. But they did get a new pair of sheets. Nice vending machines for the kids. The breakfast was just ok. I expected scrambled eggs and fresh fruit. We got biscuits and gravey and the biscuits weren't very good. The location was right near the Recplex which is what we were there for. Nice TV's and a refrigerator in our room, so that was nice. Loved the storage in the bathroom, that helped to keep the place tidy.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Barrington”
Reviews.Author: travelgal143
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed four nights at the Barrington. Every employee we came into contact with was friendly and accomodating, the entire place was spotless and quiet. It is located convenient to everything Branson has to offer. We stayed here for the indoor pool and hottub and they were both great, sparkling water and warm enough to swim comfortably. Vending machines were reasonably priced. Our room on the fourth floor was close to the elevator so I was concerned about hallway noise, but we were never disturbed. Complimentary breakfast until 9:30 a.m. was adequate with both hot and cold items every day. The only problem one might have with the rooms was there is NO storage. Three drawers, no closet, no hooks behind the doors and a handful of clothes hangers that hang from a bar in the room was all that was provided. It was fine for the two of us, but four people would probably find themselves cramped if they stayed more than a day or two. We loved this hotel so much that my daughter wants to change our reservation in October from an indoor-waterpark hotel to the Barrington!

Reviews.Title: “"My New Home Away From Home"”
Reviews.Author: mariejackson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Barrington Hotel in May. From the moment we checked in we were met with a very friendly clerk with a big smile on her face and answered all our questions. Very helpful. First impressions are important to me. This hotel met all our expectations. I have stayed at several hotels in the past and I must say this was the cleanest hotel in Branson. Every day the cleaning staff worked very hard and it showed. When we walked in our room it smell and was very clean. The beds and pillows were comfortable. The refrigerator in the room was a nice touch and greatly used. Usually I feel I have to wear shoes in the hotels rooms but not this one. We read the past reviews so we decided to go to breakfast around 8:30 and there were no lines and had no trouble getting a table. There was always plenty of food. They had 3 ladies in the breakfast area and they were always wiping tables, checking food, and asking if there was anything we needed. The variety of food offered was more than expected and all we could ask for. The indoor pool and spa was clean. Since it rained while we were there we enjoyed the indoor pool. The workout area was small but all I needed. Everyday while I worked out a staff member was there and was cleaning the equipment and surrounding. I did not feel the hotel was too far away from shopping, restaurants and theaters. Since the hotel was not on a busy street there was easy access out. I have not stopped looking for a hotel in Branson because I am Totally satisfied with this hotel. When I return you can bet we will say here again. Cannot say enough about the friendly staff , clean hotel, and amenities. Cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and honest staff”
Reviews.Author: friendlypep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barrington Hotel for 5 nights. It is centrally located and its staff are friendly and honest. I lost my bracelet and after telling the front desk, the staff found it and returned to me the next day. It would be great if breakfast can have some changes; for example, instead of boiled eggs every morning, scrambled egg is a good change.

Reviews.Title: “Only blemish is long lines at breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: ARtraveler63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with a group. Check in by courteous and friendly staff was speedy. Lobby is small, but ample. Just off the lobby there is a sitting area with a computer for guest's use. Our room, a King Suite had a sitting area and hot tub. Some in our party mentioned the small vanity in the bathroom, but my husband and I had no problems. There is a flat screen TV. I helped one of our group to her non-smoking room which had a strong aroma of smoke. The front desk quickly responded to her concern with a thorough spraying. I'm not sure I would have been able to remain in the room even after the deoderizing, but the staff did try to correct the problem. Our room had no unpleasant aroma and was very clean. The drapes on the windows are 3 layers. There is a top decorative layer, a middle sheer, and a black out layer next to the window. I provide this information because it took me a while to determine how to close the window treatment for privacy. The continental breakfast (6:30 - 9 am) is provided in rooms on the 3rd floor. Because we had to leave for our meeting at 8 am, we determined to be at the door when breakfast opened. At that time, there was already a long line outside the door. We couldn't even get in the room to check the offerings to see if we wanted to wait in line without those standing in line thinking we were breaking the line. We would have liked to get our breakfast and take it to our room, but, to do this, we would still have to stand in the long line. We continued to check the line until about 7:45, and it remained as long as it had been at 6:30. If you stay at this hotel, I would suggest waiting for breakfast until about 8:30. I asked the desk clerk the breakfast line was always long, and she indicated it was because they had a large bus clientele. I would suggest that the hotel consider providing another breakfast area for guest who would just grab a cup of coffee or juice and a roll and return to their room. To end on a positive note, the beds were comfortable, and there was an extra pillow and blanket in the chest. I would recommend this hotel to a friend, but would certainly make them aware of the breakfast arrangement.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sueanne21
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Barrington Hotel and are both extremely impressed with the cleanliness, breakfast and ALL the staff working here. We travel USA 5 weeks per year and we both agree that for the cost the Barrington is one of the best value hotels we have stayed in....and I did say for the COST..... The staff here are wonderful, the breakfast room ladies are first class. The decor is tasteful, the pool and spa wonderful. We would definately recommend this hotel to our friends and yes, if we come back here to Branson its the BARRINGTON my hubby and I will be staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Ardmora
Reviews.Content: Staff - Extremely friendly and helpful! Except for one in the dining room (breakfast) not too friendly I only saw her the first morning (April 5) did not greet us.... Carpets dirty.... Airconditioning units very noisy... I can't sleep every time it kicked to turn on and off..... I like the computer room, only one computer, will be good to add another one.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: albertaveracity
Reviews.Content: newly renovated, clean, complimentary breakfast better than average ( great waffles, hard-boiled eggs , sausages some days, instant oat meal, muffins, biscuits and gravy, bagels, fruits etc.), room spacious enough, bed and pillows very comfortable, staff helpful. Location excellent -- away from Strip but close enough to everything. Everywhere is less than 10 minutes away (in April).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: k71157
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms. Friendly staff. Comfortable beds. Great value. Couldn't have asked for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TriptakerFt_Smith_AR
Reviews.Content: If your going to Branson, you need to to check out this hotel. They do an outstanding job of accommodating your needs. Very nice interior design. Rooms beautiful. Pillow top beds are great Indoor pool for the kids is very nice. Still a bit cool but that's to be expected the week before Christmas. But you can swim in it and not freeze. It's a big pool; hard to heat that much water. Hot tub was very nice. For the price(mid 50's) on a weekend you will not find a better deal. I've looked. Worth every dime. It's a bit out of the way but still easy to get to. No traffic around so it's very quiet. Internet access in lobby easy to use. They are proud of their renovations so don't even think of smoking there or you will get dinged. I like that. A word of advice.. the breakfast is very popular and good, so make plans on how to attack it. It does get crowded and you will have to be there by 9:30 because they do shut it down. Not really a negative just be aware if you have to take kids with you. Didn't try the exercise room, but it's convenient. Negatives- maybe the shower heads were a little low. Really that's about it. Overall a really impressive hotel and I will definitely return here. If they can't satisfy you than no one can and that's all you can ask for in service.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely check this place out!”
Reviews.Author: njmackley
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to when we checked out (Thursday afternoon to Sunday morning), this was a very nice place to stay. The front desk staff was so hospitable, calling soon after we got to our room to make sure it was okay. We were with a tour that was hosted by Gatherings Plus, and they were excellent. They took us to the various shows, helped our seniors get off and on the bus, took us into the theaters the fastest ways, and just took care of us. Back to the hotel: the only complaints I have are that the room doors did not shut on their own. It took a conscious effort to make sure the doors closed and were locked. On Sunday, the elevators were not working properly. With our mother in a wheelchair, that was the only way she could get to the continental breakfast on the 3rd floor, and back down again. The breakfast was very good with lots of choices, but at least when we were there, it was very crowded. It was often hard to find a table to sit at, and waiting in line to get cereal, juice, or make a waffle was normal. One computer in the lobby area was enough to check email quickly. I didn't bring a laptop, but I believe they had free wireless. Many of us were flying out of Springfield and Kansas City, so it was great to have the front desk staff do the check-in and print boarding passes for us. One woman needed more training on how to do that, though... It was a distance to go to the theaters, but I didn't mind being away from the congestion of the main roads. Overall, for the price we paid and for the location, it was a very good deal. I'd go back again!

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong staying at this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingplaces72
Reviews.Content: Barrington Hotel far exceeded our expectations! The staff was very nice & helpful. They did an exceptional job remodeling the whole hotel. The location was in close driving distance to everything we wanted to do. We would definately go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nice for the price!”
Reviews.Author: flatlandmandan
Reviews.Content: Hi, we staying at the great barrington hotel for 2 nights. overall we were happy with our stay.We booked on hotels.com for $47 a night fri-sat stay. Great deal! the hotel is clean and nicely decorated. located just off of 2 of bransons back routes made it very easy to drive places. not in walking distance of bransons main attractions .staff was friendly. the cont breakfast wasnt nothing special and was short 7-9am. who wants to get up and around on a getaway or vaction that early??? donuts,coffee,milk,juice,muffins,biscuts/gravy and cereal. all dirrect from a package! in my opinion. but i figured we saved enough on our room not to worry about the breakfast. our only complaints were the shower head in out bathroom was very low maybe 5ft ?? spraying out about shoulder height you really had to duck to get under it and i am not a tall guy. they also need a curved shower rod to give you more room in shower. one more thing our bathroom didnt have a working heater in it. so was cold getting out of the shower. over all i would stay there again. i hope the staff reads these and makes some improvements on the issues i touched on.They seemed very friendly and wanting to make your stay a good one.I have stayed at many hotels in branson and this one is worth staying at again. have a great trip and enjoy life

Reviews.Title: “family reunion”
Reviews.Author: TBC005
Reviews.Content: It was my job to select a hotel and book 5 rooms for this trip. My wife and I had stayed at Barrington two previous times and were very well pleased, so there was no doubts with us. But selecting for others is something else. Everyone was extremely well pleased with the hotel, the breakfast, the price and the location. It is very easy to access the outer roads to any place in Branson or Silver Dollar City. (WE will be back !!). T.C. West Plains MO.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE the Barrington!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: k20hawaii
Reviews.Content: Well, my stay at the Barrington was EXCELLENT!! The staff was very helpful and friendly-and we had no problems at all. The pool was very relaxing, as well as the hot tub. The breakfast in the mornings are wonderful also-you have to it! We will be returning guests-that is certain!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place -- will be going back soon”
Reviews.Author: kaykatsmom
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. It's clean, quite, and roomy. My daughter and I had a room looking over the pool but it was still really quite. It's a litter hard to find -- the signage could be a little better, but it's worth the hunt. And the biscuits and gravy for breakfast was fantastic. I'd highly reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveBranson59
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Jacuzzi Suites for 4 days October 2007 and it was wonderful. The hotel was clean and the room was clean and huge. We had a king size bed, love seat, table & 2 chairs, wet bar with frig, Microwave and coffee maker. The bathroom was extra large with an additional sink outside the bathroom. Could not have asked for a better vacation. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price, more than I expected”
Reviews.Author: SEKANSASLady
Reviews.Content: Hi! We stayed here for two nights. We travel to Branson ALOT! and sadly we are spoiled and like to stay at a more upscale facility, but we wanted to cut expenses a little. We booked this through hotwire. Like I said we come here alot so i was surprised I had never stayed here, then checking out reviews on here I was skeptical. What a delightful surprise. Sure it wasn't a 4 or 5 star, but it was pretty nice. Very clean. Good beds. A little out dated but that gave it character. Nice pool area. Nice lounge area. We did have an issue with housekeeping. They threw away food. I had never had that happen. I thought they werent suppose to throw anything away unless it was in the trash or by the trash. We had left over pizza sitting on the table, they through it away. I was shocked. We had alot left over and had had it in a cooler, but took it out just before we left so we could dump and refill the cooler with ice. We came back an hour later and it was gone. I called the front desk, at first it was like oh well, then we explained the price of the pizze because it was gourmet and we were planning on eating it. Well about 45 minutes later, the manager called, apologized over and over. I said thats okay, I just appreciate the call from you and the apology. About an hour later there was a knock at the door and it was the pizza delivery. They had reordered our entire order!!! and they paid for it!!! I was totally shocked!! still am. Talk about ozark hospitality!!!! They didnt have to do that. With service like that I would gladly stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “only as last resort”
Reviews.Author: v82
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as no other available for time period needed, very dusty in room, carpet had stains, remote not working, and room had funny smell, perhaps spray to cover other smells. On up side, towels very white and soft, granite sinks, and heat/air worked without too much noise. Stayed two nights and room didn't get cleaned until 5 pm on second day. Breakfast area clean, but items offered were limited. This hotel needs an infusion of new mattresses, carpet and vacuuming.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & nice quiet location away from the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Peddlers
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation through HotelLocators.com and were quite pleased with our stay. The staff was friendly, the room was clean, nice & roomy. The breakfast included biscuits & gravey, toast, bagels, cereals, juice, etc. & was very nice. We felt it was a very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Fake fees”
Reviews.Author: skizzatt
Reviews.Content: The problem I had was the $5.00 credit card fee tacked onto my bill. I reserved three rooms all at the same time and all under my credit account. I was charged the fee 3 times! Once for each room. I will not go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Marine reunion will go Again next year!”
Reviews.Author: nassb68
Reviews.Content: I booked our Marine Reunion here site unseen through the Branson Tourism Bureau. We had apx. 15 rooms. Everyone enjoyed it so much we arranged to go again next year. I had no complaints from anyone and the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Im_Eruditer_Than_You
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took advantage of the "Coffee Lover's Special," which was eighty dollars and included a King jacuzzi suite and enough coffee for 48 cups. The room was very nice, very clean, and quiet. The pool was ice cold and the staff was very helpful. The deluxe continental breakfast wasn't bad, either. My only complaint is that the halls aren't very well air conditioned. Aside from that, I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “wouldnt stay again”
Reviews.Author: jennsniffer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay. We called ahead of time to request a non-smoking room. When we arrived, the hotel had not booked us in a non-smoking room. The desk clerk stated they would try to get us in a non-smoking room. Our room was a non-smoking room on the smoking floor. The hotel smelled like a dirty ashtray. The food that they had for the continental breakfast was terrible. We ended up eating out for breakfast.

HotelInfo.Name: Barrington Hotel & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 263 Shepherd Of The Hills Expressway, Branson, MO 65616
